file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-30-02-04 - COMPARTMENT LIGHT SWITCH REFLECTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COMPARTMENT LIGHT SWITCH REFLECTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the reflector of the light assemblies installed in: • Nose Landing Gear Compartment • Forward Electronic Compartment • Control Rigging Compartment • Fuel/Defuel control panel Compartment • Rear Electronic Compartment • Tail Cone Compartment B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY COMPARTMENT LIGHT REFLECTOR - ALL 33-30-02-000-801-A REMOVAL (TYPICAL) COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY RE- ALL 33-30-02-400-801-A FLECTOR - INSTALLATION (TYPICAL) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-30-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-30-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COMPARTMENT LIGHT REFLECTOR - REMOVAL (TYPICAL) A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the light reflectors installed in the compartments included on the list above. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113/114 Nose Landing Gear Compartment 213/214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment 123/124 123BL Control Rigging Compartment 191 191BR Fuel/Defuel Control Panel Compartment 271/272 272DR Rear Electronic Compartment 311/312 312AR Tail Cone Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/COMPT) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) On the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), open the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: RB SERVBUS/COMPT LT) and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Do this item for the relamping of the fuel/defuel control panel light assembly. (a) On the circuit breaker panel, open the REFUELING 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Gain access to the related compartment. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the screws (4) and remove the protective lens (3) and gasket (5). (2) Remove the screws (6) that attach the reflector (2) to the support (1). (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (7). (4) Remove the reflector (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Compartment Light Reflector - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 213/214 FORWARD ELECTRONIC A COMPARTMENT ZONE 191 FUEL/DEFUEL CONTROL PANEL COMPARTMENT A ZONES 113/114 NOSE LANDING GEAR COMPARTMENT A ZONES 123/124 CONTROL RIGGING COMPARTMENT A A ZONES 311/312 ZONES 271/271 TAIL CONE REAR ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT COMPARTMENT 1. SUPPORT 7. ELECTRICAL 2. REFLECTOR CONNECTOR 6. SCREW 5. GASKET LAMP 4. SCREW 3. PROTECTIVE LENS DET. A 145AMM330065.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-30-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY REFLECTOR - INSTALLATION (TYPICAL) A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the compartment light assembly reflectors. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 BAGGAGE AND SERVICE COMPARTMENT LIGHTS - AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500 OPERATIONAL TEST COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY LAMP - REMOV- AMM TASK 33-30-01-000-801-A/400 AL (TYPICAL) C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113/114 Nose Landing Gear Compartment 213/214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment 123/124 123BL Control Rigging Compartment 191 191BR Fuel/Defuel Control Panel Compartment 271/272 272DR Rear Electronic Compartment 311/312 312AR Tail Cone Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Where applicable I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (7). (2) Put the reflector (2) in its installation position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-30-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Tighten the screws (6) which attach the reflector (2) to the support (1). (4) Install the lamp (AMM TASK 33-30-01-000-801-A/400), if it is not installed. (5) Install the gasket (5) and the protective lens (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/COMPT) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) On the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), close the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: RB SERVBUS/COMPT LT) and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the REFUELING 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it, if applicable. (4) Do the operational test of the related compartment light ( AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-30-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
